TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Policy extends System.Object implements class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: An information policy that resides on a site, is applied to a content type, or is applied to a list.

remarks.para: An information management policy is a set of rules for a certain type of important content. Policy enables administrators to control and evaluate who can access the information, how long to retain information, and how effectively people are complying with the policy itself.

Logically, each policy is a collection of instruction sets for one or more policy features. For each policy feature that you want to include in a policy, you include an instruction set, called a policy item, in the policy. A policy item contains the settings for only one policy feature.
For more information about information policies and policy features, see Introduction to Information Management Policy.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property BlockPreview As Boolean
public: property bool BlockPreview { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Reserved for internal use.

.method public static hidebysig void CreatePolicy(class Microsoft.SharePoint.SPContentType ct, class Microsoft.Office.RecordsManagement.InformationPolicy.Policy globalPolicy) cil managed
Public Shared Sub CreatePolicy (ct As SPContentType, globalPolicy As Policy)

Docs.param: The object in which to create the information policy.
The site information policy to copy into the specified content type.
Docs.summary: Creates an information policy in the specified content type.

remarks.para: If you pass a null reference as the parameter, Microsoft SharePoint Server 2010 creates an empty information policy in the content type.
Information policies are stored in objects as an XMLDocument object. For more information about information policies in content types, see Policies in Content Types.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig void DeletePolicy(class Microsoft.SharePoint.SPContentType ct) cil managed
Public Shared Sub DeletePolicy (ct As SPContentType)

Docs.param: The from which to remove the information policy.
Docs.summary: Removes the information policy from the specified content type.

remarks.para: For more information about information policies in content types, see Policies in Content Types.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Description { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a concise description of the information management policy.
Docs.value: A string that represents the policy description.

remarks.para: Microsoft SharePoint Server 2010 displays this description in the Central Administration interface.

public: static property System::String ^ ExemptFieldInternalName { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Reserved for internal use.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Xml.XmlDocument Export() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates an XML rendering of the information policy.
Docs.returns: An XmlDocument object that represents the information policy in XML format.

remarks.para: Exporting an information policy as XML enables you to import that policy into another site collection. To do so, use the method of the object for that site collection.
For more information about the information policy schema, see Policy Schema Overview.

Public Shared Function GetPolicy (ct As SPContentType) As Policy

Docs.param: The for which to get the information policy.
Docs.summary: Gets the information policy for the specified content type.
Docs.returns: A object that represent the information policy for the content type.

remarks.para: For more information about information policies in content types, see Policies in Content Types.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Id As String
public: property System::String ^ Id { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the GUID of the policy.
Docs.value: A string that represents the policy GUID.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig bool InheritsPolicy(class Microsoft.SharePoint.SPContentType ct) cil managed
Public Shared Function InheritsPolicy (ct As SPContentType) As Boolean

Docs.param: The object for which to determine whether its information policy inherits from a site policy.
Docs.summary: Gets whether the specified content type inherits its information policy from a site policy, or has an information policy created for that content type.
Docs.returns: true if the content type inherits its information policy from a site policy; false if the information policy was created directly on the content type.

remarks.para: For more information about information policies in content types, see Policies in Content Types.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig bool IsItemExempt(class Microsoft.SharePoint.SPListItem item) cil managed
Public Shared Function IsItemExempt (item As SPListItem) As Boolean

Docs.summary: Gets whether the specified list item is exempt from the information policy applied to it.
Docs.returns: true if the specified list item is exempt from the information policy applied to it; false if it is not.

remarks.para: Use the method to make a list item exempt from the information policy applied to it. Use the to remove such an exemption from a list item.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsLocal As Boolean
public: property bool IsLocal { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Reserved for internal use.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Items As PolicyItemCollection

Docs.summary: The collection of policy items included in this information policy.
Docs.value: A object that represents the policy items included in this information policy.

remarks.para: Each object contained in the object contains properties that configure a policy feature that is included in the information management policy.
For more information about information policies and policy features, see Introduction to Information Management Policy.

public: property System::String ^ ModifiedBy { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.value: A string that represents the user name of the last person to modify this information policy.

public: property DateTime ModifiedDate { DateTime get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the time and date when this information policy was last modified.
Docs.value: A DateTime object that represents the time and date when this information policy was last modified.

Docs.value: A string that represents the policy name that is displayed in the SharePoint Server 2010 interface.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig void RemoveExemption(class Microsoft.SharePoint.SPListItem item) cil managed
Public Shared Sub RemoveExemption (item As SPListItem)

Docs.param: The list item from which to remove the information policy exemption.
Docs.summary: Removes the information policy exemption from the specified list item.

remarks.para: Use the method to make a list item exempt from the information policy applied to it. Use the method to determine if a list item is exempt from the information policy applied to it.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Statement { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the long description of the information management policy.
Docs.value: A string that represents the long description of the information management policy.

remarks.para: This description is displayed to end users in the SharePoint Server 2010 user interface.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Update() cil managed

Docs.summary: Writes the changes made to the policy back to the SharePoint content database.

remarks.para: If you do not call this method, any changes you have made programmatically to the policy are not saved.

Docs.param: The XML information policy definition to validate.
Docs.summary: Validates the specified XML information policy definition.

remarks.para: For more information about the information policy schema, see Policy Schema Overview.
